titleStmt.title: Sentence of the praefect Valerius Eudaemon

msItemStruct.note: Location: Department of Special Collections; Memorial Library; Madison; Wisconsin
Pub. status: recto; verso is blank
The writing is along the fibers. The text is written with deep black ink. Margins are: top 1 cm; bottom: 3 cm; left-hand side 1 cm; right-hand side 2.5 cm. The leetrs are uncommonly large

p.note: A light-brown papyrus, regularly cut/brokenoff at all sides. There is some damage at the six vertical folds.

div.ab: Year six of Antoninus Caesar the lord, the sevententh Mecheir. With Kallinikos, former village secretary, in attendance. And Kallinikos having approached the tribunal, after other matters Eudaimon said to Kallinikos: "What did you have in mind when you put forward an indigent man for liturgy? Being the cause of his flight, you (thereby) were the cause that his possessions were sold. You are subject to mpenalties. In the treasury office you will pay the fines, but, also, to him four times as much as that for which his property was sold.

listBibl.bibl: Boswinkel - Sijpesteijn, Greek Papyri, pl. 19;;GHR Horsley, New Documnets Illustrating Early Christianity [ppayri year 1977], no 23 Westermann WL , JEA 40, 107-111, 1954 -- VI 9315 Sijpesteijn PJ , P.Wisc. II, 81, 1977, Plate XXXVII
